t: How do I request GTIN exemption from Amazon? – Printful Help Center

t: What are product IDs or GTINs? - Sell on Amazon
s: January 11, 2025 - A product ID is a series of numbers that are assigned to a product to help identify it through the supply chain as it moves from a manufacturer to a seller or retailer, and then to a customer. A GTIN, or Global Trade Item Number, is considered a product ID.

t: What is Global Trade Item Number (GTIN)? Know its meaning, types, and benefits
s: These indicator digits are used in GTIN-14 only. This is a unique number assigned to the trade item. This varies in length depending on the company prefix. For example, if the company prefix is 8-digit long, then item reference number will be 4-digit long. This is a unique number licensed to a company by the GS1 member organization, which exists in over 110 countries. These prefixes are assigned as per a business or brand...

t: How to Apply for GTIN Exemption on Amazon – GearBubble
s: Amazon mandates that products sold on its marketplace must possess a unique identifier, such as a UPC (Unique Product Code) or a GTIN (Global Trade Item Number). In the event that you develop a product lacking an identifier, you are required to request a GTIN Exemption.

t: Brand Registry / GTIN Exemption for small start ups
s: Hi. We are a new seller who are going to start our own brand business on Amazon. We have a registered partnership firm but we dont have GTIN and Trademarks as yet. We first want to check the sales, and accordingly in future would go for them as that costs a lot for small sellers.
